attributes.action: Start seeing GP’s Face to Face again
attributes.additional_details:
Parliament made the rules, therefore it’s parliament job to reverse the rules. 
I also believe this will remove pressure on A&E as people won’t take it upon themselves to find the only way to see a doctor is via a hospital as first port of call.
attributes.background: We can already travel public transport, sit in a theatre, pub or restaurant. We have to see dentists and chiropodists face to face. All that separates us is a mask. Well let’s wear masks if needs be, but allow us to see GP’s face to face again.

rejection.details: There are no Government restrictions that prevent GPs from holding face-to-face appointments. Decisions relating to GP appointments, including decisions on whether face-to-face appointments are appropriate, are operational matters for the NHS and individual GPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.
